Html:
Hello,

I'm having a hell of a time getting PhpExcel to work properly. I've tried to get it to work on my shared Linux hosting account, but the file would always be empty (0 bytes).
Linux Machine
PHP 5.2.1 - enabled with zip, gd & xml_rpc

So I said alright, I'll try phpExcel on my windows box using Wamp server (http://www.wampserver.com/en/).
Windows PHP 5.2.8 - enabled with zip, gd & xml_rpc

The result on the windows box was it created a file that was ~6k, but is "unreadable" by Excel 2007.


In both cases I am only trying to run the "Hello world" example as shown
http://www.codeplex.com/PHPExcel/Wiki/View.aspx?title=Examples&referringTitle=Home

(I am able to see the excel file properly from that link, so it's not my excel installation).


Can someone help me with these 2 cases? I know the requirements say use php_xml, but it seems like that dll is deprecated. I searched all over for it, but could not find it. (Only found posts saying xmlrpc / php5.2 should handle the xml, and don't need it. I also tried enabaling php_domxml. But that did not change anything.)

Please let me know if you need any additional information on these cases.



Thanks,


Tim

There are unfortunately known problems with recent PHP installations on Windows. Check FAQ section "Excel 2007 can not open the file generated by PHPExcelWriter2007 on Windows".
Also check latest posts in this discussion.

I would suggest that you first try to get it working on Linux first using the included tests in the release download.
